Constructor Detail

Box

public Box(java.lang.String name,
           float minX,
           float minY,
           float minZ,
           float maxX,
           float maxY,
           float maxZ)
Creates a new box by defining two opposing end points. Each minimum coordinate must be less than the maximum coordinate in order to have all normals pointing outwards.

Parameters:
name - name of the spatial for identifying purposes
minX - minimum point in the x-axis
minY - minimum point in the y-axis
minZ - minimum point in the z-axis
maxX - maximum point in the x-axis
maxY - maximum point in the y-axis
maxZ - maximum point in the z-axis

Box

public Box(java.lang.String name,
           float widthX,
           float widthY,
           float widthZ)
Creates a new box centered at the origin.

Parameters:
name - name of the spatial for identifying purposes
widthX - width of the box in the x-axis
widthY - width of the box in the y-axis
widthZ - width of the box in the z-axis

Box

public Box(java.lang.String name,
           float[] centerP,
           float widthX,
           float widthY,
           float widthZ)
Creates a new box with the specified center point (array of length with x,y,z) and width. If the center point array is null or of the wrong length, (0,0,0) is used.

Parameters:
name - name of the spatial for identifying purposes
centerP - center point of box as an array of length 3 containing the coordinates in x,y,z
widthX - width of the box in the x-axis
widthY - width of the box in the y-axis
widthZ - width of the box in the z-axis
